dt: {bc}a fundamental or characteristic part or quality
{bc}ultimate reality that underlies all outward manifestations and change

dt.t: the … bill—which will be without {wi}substance{/wi} in the sense that it will authorize nothing more than a set of ideas

dt: {bc}physical material from which something is made or which has discrete existence
{bc}matter of particular or definite chemical constitution
{bc}something (such as drugs or alcoholic beverages) deemed harmful and usually subject to legal restriction

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from Latin {it}substantia{/it}, from {it}substant-, substans{/it}, present participle of {it}substare{/it} to stand under, from {it}sub-{/it} + {it}stare{/it} to stand {ma}{mat|stand|}{/ma}
shortdef: a fundamental or characteristic part or quality

dt: {bc}a more or less homogeneous matrix in which the specific differentiated elements of a system are suspended:

shortdef: a more or less homogeneous matrix in which the specific differentiated elements of a system are suspended:

dt: {bc}a pheromone secreted by queen bees that is consumed by worker bees and inhibits ovary development

shortdef: a pheromone secreted by queen bees that is consumed by worker bees and inhibits ovary development

dt: {bc}a usually fluid substance that through changes of temperature, volume, and pressure is the means of carrying out thermodynamic processes or cycles (as in a heat engine)

shortdef: a usually fluid substance that through changes of temperature, volume, and pressure is the means of carrying out thermodynamic processes or cycles (as in a heat engine)
